snippet: Retail sales of video game hardware, software and accessories in the United States fell 34 percent in January.
abstract: NPD Group says retail sales of video game hardware, software and accessories in the United States fell 34 percent in January, to $751 million, compared with a year earlier; cites a lack of new games as driving cause.
lead_paragraph: Retail sales of video game hardware, software and accessories in the United States fell 34 percent in January.

headline.main: Sales of Video Games and Accessories Fell in January
headline.print_headline: Sales Of Video Games and Accessories Fell In January
